         <h1 class="syndicate"> Talk with Your Doctor about Depression </h1> 
         <img id="content_contentImage" class="icon-image" alt="" src="/HealthTopics/glmedia/icons/talkwithyourdoctoraboutdepression.jpg"> 
        </div>

           <div id="the-basics" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">The Basics</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_152"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Overview</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>If you think you might be depressed, talk with a doctor about how you are feeling.</p>
               <p><strong>What is depression?</strong><br>Depression is an illness that involves the brain. It can affect your thoughts, mood, and daily activities. Depression is more than feeling sad for a few days.</p>
               <p>Depression can be mild or severe. Mild depression can become more serious if its not treated.</p>
               <p>If you are diagnosed with depression, you arent alone. Depression is a common illness that affects millions of adults in the United&nbsp;States&nbsp;every year.</p>
               <p>The good news is that depression can be treated. Getting help is the best thing you can do for yourself and your loved ones. You can feel better.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#the-basics_2">Signs of Depression</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">1 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_153"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Signs of Depression</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>What are the signs of depression?</strong><br>Its normal to feel sad sometimes, but if you feel sad or down on most days for more than 2 weeks at a time, you may be depressed.</p>
               <p>Depression affects people differently. Some signs of depression are:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Losing interest in activities you used to enjoy</li>
                <li>Feeling hopeless or empty</li>
                <li>Forgetting things or having trouble making decisions</li>
                <li>Sleeping too much or too little</li>
                <li>Gaining or losing weight without meaning to</li>
                <li>Thinking about suicide or death</li>
               </ul>
               <p>To learn more, take this <a href="https://www.myhealth.va.gov/mhv-portal-web/web/myhealthevet/depression-screening">quiz to see if you might be depressed</a>.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#the-basics_3">Treatment</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_1">Overview</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">2 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_414"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Treatment</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>How is depression treated?</strong><br>Depression can be treated with talk therapy, medicines (called antidepressants), or both. Your doctor may refer you to a mental health professional&nbsp;for talk therapy or medicine.</p>
               <p>Check out these websites to learn more about depression:</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="http://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/publications/depression-easy-to-read/introduction.shtml" target="_blank">General information about depression</a></li>
                <li><a href="https://www.nia.nih.gov/health/depression-and-older-adults" target="_blank">Information for older adults</a></li>
                <li><a href="http://www.womenshealth.gov/mental-health/illnesses/depression.html" target="_blank">Information for women</a></li>
                <li><a href="https://www.cdc.gov/features/maternal-depression/index.html">Information for pregnant women and new moms</a></li>
                <li><a href="https://www.mentalhealth.gov/get-help/veterans" target="_blank">Resources for veterans</a></li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_2" class="button next" href="#take-action_1">See a Doctor</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_2" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_2">Signs of Depression</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_2" class="content_page_range">3 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <div class="clear"></div> 
           </div> 
           <div id="take-action" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">Take Action!</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_155"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>See a Doctor</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>Depression is a real illness. If you think you might be depressed, see your doctor.</p>
               <p><strong>Talk to a doctor about how you are feeling.</strong><br>Get a medical checkup. Ask to see a doctor or nurse who can screen you for depression.</p>
               <p>The doctor or nurse may also check to see if&nbsp;you have another health condition&nbsp;(like thyroid disease) that can cause depression or make it worse. If you have one of these health conditions, its important to get treatment right away.</p>
               <p><strong><em>What about cost?</em></strong><br>Under the <a href="https://www.healthcare.gov/health-care-law-protections/" target="_blank">Affordable Care Act</a>, the health care reform law passed in 2010, insurance plans must cover screening for depression. This means&nbsp;you may be able to get screened at no cost to&nbsp;you.</p>
               <p>If you dont have insurance, you can still get health care. <a href="https://findahealthcenter.hrsa.gov/" target="_blank">Find a health center near you</a> and make an appointment.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#take-action_2">Get Treatment</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_0" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_3">Treatment</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">4 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_156"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Get Treatment</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Get treatment for depression.</strong><br>When you have depression, seeking help is the best thing you can do. Depression can be treated with talk therapy, medicines, or both.</p>
               <p>Ask your doctor for a referral to a mental health professional or <a href="https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/" target="_blank">use this treatment locator to find mental health services near you</a>. Some programs offer free or low-cost treatment if you don't have insurance.&nbsp;</p>
               <p>Here are some places you can go to for help with depression:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Doctors office or health clinic</li>
                <li>Family service or social service agency</li>
                <li>Psychologist (sy-KAH-lah-jist)</li>
                <li>Counselor or social worker</li>
                <li>Psychotherapist (sy-koh-THAYR-uh-pist)</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Remember, even if asking for help seems scary, it's an important step toward feeling better.&nbsp;</p>
               <p>Check out this guide to&nbsp;<a href="https://secure2.convio.net/dabsa/pdfs/FaPro.pdf" target="_blank">finding a mental health professional [PDF - 2.84 MB]</a>.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#take-action_3">Support for Depression</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#take-action_1">See a Doctor</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">5 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_157"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Support for Depression</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Get support.</strong><br>If you have depression, it can also help to reach out for social support. You don't have to face depression alone. A trusted family member, friend, or faith leader can help support you as you seek out medical treatment.&nbsp;</p>
               <p>Get more ideas for <a href="https://www.mentalhealth.gov/talk/people-mental-health-problems" target="_blank">building your support system</a>.</p>
               <p><strong>Get active</strong>.<br><a href="/HealthTopics/Category/health-conditions-and-diseases/diabetes/get-active">Getting active</a> can lower your stress level and help your treatment work better. It can also help keep you from getting depressed again. But it's important to know that physical activity isn't a treatment for depression.&nbsp;</p>
               <p><strong>If someone you care about is depressed, get help.</strong><br>If you think a friend or family member may be depressed, check out these tips on&nbsp;<a href="/HealthTopics/Category/everyday-healthy-living/mental-health-and-relationship/depression-conversation-starters">how to talk to a loved one about depression</a>.</p>
               <p>Find more&nbsp;<a href="https://www.nami.org/Find-Support/Living-with-a-Mental-Health-Condition">resources for people living with a mental health condition</a>.</p>
               <p><strong><strong><em>Get help right away if you or someone you know is thinking about suicide.</em></strong></strong></p>
               <ul>
                <li>To get help for yourself or someone else, visit the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/" target="_blank">National Suicide Prevention Lifeline</a>&nbsp;or call 1-800-273-TALK (1-800-273-8255).</li>
                <li>If someone is in immediate danger, call 911.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix">
